description: Be among the first to see highly critically acclaimed curated films that are n... Includes five critically acclaimed curated films, curated by film programmer David Schwartz. Enjoy exclusive post-film interviews, reserved seating, and a members-only e-newsletter. Beer, wine, and snacks are available for purchase, and a complimentary reception is included for Film Club members. Film titles are kept secret until showtime. Please note this is a subscription series; individual film tickets are not available.
location: Emelin Theatre For The Performing Arts

description: Jazz-pop vocalist Kat Edmonson performs live with acoustic guitar and cello in an intimate performance. As described by The New York Times, she is “A savvy student of ’60s film soundtracks, jazz-pop stylings, and Brill Building songcraft.” With a style that blends vintage pop, cabaret, and jazz with cinematic flair, Edmonson offers a sound that is both nostalgic and uniquely her own. Accompanied by acoustic guitar and cello, her airy vocals, poetic lyrics, and refined stage presence invite audiences into a world of storytelling.
location: Emelin Theatre, 153 Library Lane, Mamaroneck, NY, 10543, United States

description: Clean, smart comedy from a viral sensation with timeless appeal. Brad has shared the stage with the likes of Joan Rivers, Dolly Parton, and Johnny Mathis, and has performed in all 50 states and around the world. His viral Dry Bar Comedy specials have introduced millions of new fans to his smart, side-splitting storytelling and no-nonsense wit. Known for his clean, relatable humor and razor-sharp timing, Brad effortlessly mines laughs from everyday life, marriage, parenting, aging, and everything in between.
location: Emelin Theatre For The Performing Arts, 153 Library Lane, Mamaroneck, NY 10543 United States

description: Storm Large dashes in with her signature “Holiday Ordeal,” an evening of wickedly funny, deeply personal, and wildly entertaining holiday anthems and originals. Best known for her powerhouse vocals, off-the-cuff humor, and genre-bending performances, Storm brings a cathartic mix of humor and heart to the season. Expect a cocktail of holiday classics, rock-n-roll ballads, and tongue-in-cheek torch songs delivered with powerhouse vocals and a wink. A long-time member of Pink Martini and a fan favorite from America’s Got Talent, Storm is beloved for her magnetic stage presence and fearless honesty. Whether she’s crooning I’ll Be Home for Christmas or belting out an edgy original, her holiday show is anything but ordinary. Join us for a night of irreverent cheer, emotional release, and musical brilliance. Just the way the holidays should be.
location: Emelin Theatre, 153 Library Lane, Mamaroneck, NY, 10543, United States

event: The Martin Sexton Abbey Road Show
description: Reimagines The Beatles’ Abbey Road with soul and passion. Acclaimed singer-songwriter Martin Sexton returns and puts his own soulful, blues-infused spin on The Beatles’ legendary *Abbey Road* album in this one-of-a-kind tribute concert. Known for his remarkable vocal range and powerful live performances, Sexton reimagines these timeless songs with heartfelt storytelling and masterful musicianship. Expect an evening celebrating one of the greatest albums ever recorded, brought to life through the voice and artistry of a true American troubadour.
location: Emelin Theatre For The Performing Arts, 153 Library Lane, Mamaroneck, NY 10543, United States

description: The soulful, fun-loving powerhouse all women's sextet fuses klezmer tradition with jazz, swing, and global influences. Seen and heard on HBO, NPR, CBS Sunday Morning, PBS, and The L Word, Isle of Klezbos has been praised by The New York Times for its “intoxicating mix of tradition and irreverence.”
location: Emelin Theatre, 153 Library Lane, Mamaroneck, NY, 10543, United States

description: Adaptation of the beloved holiday classic by Carole Alexis featuring professional dancers of Ballet des Amériques. Inspired by the work of Rudolf Nureyev and Marius Petipa, this 90-minute adaptation by French-American choreographer Carole Alexis is an exquisite interpretation of the beloved holiday classic. Professional dancers of Ballet des Amériques will perform the featured roles of the ballet, with additional roles performed by young dancers from our area selected by auditions.
location: Emelin Theatre, 153 Library Lane, Mamaroneck, NY 10543 United States

event: Nov. 18: Veterans program at Members Get-together
description: A program on World War II veterans will be featured at the Mamaroneck Historical Society's November Members Get-together. The meeting is 7 p.m. Tuesday, Nov. 18, at the Woman's Club of Mamaroneck, 504 Cortlandt Avenue. We will be showing a program produced by a former Historical Society president, William Fraser, that showcased World War II veterans who fought during the battles of Okinawa in the Marines and Navy. Several heroic stories will be retold of action that took place during the battle. Tales of saving lives during kamikaze attacks told by local Mamaroneck boys are part of the forgotten details retold by men who were actually there.
location: Woman's Club of Mamaroneck, 504 Cortlandt Avenue, Mamaroneck, NY, 10543 United States

event: Oct. 21 Members Get-together: Revolutionary Westchester 250 event plans
description: Upcoming events celebrating the 250th anniversary of the Revolutionary War will be the topic at the October Mamaroneck Historical Society Members Get-together. Society President John Pritts will speak during the meeting, 7 p.m. Tuesday, Oct. 21, at the Woman's Club of Mamaroneck, 504 Cortlandt Avenue. Revolutionary War 250 is planning on big events to celebrate Westchester’s part in our early efforts for freedom from the British. In October of 1776 the Skirmish on Heathcote Hill took place right here in our town. 750 American troops were sent by George Washington stationed in White Plains to surprise British troops camped on Heathcote Hill under the leadership of Colonel Rogers. Rogers' headquarters was the original schoolhouse located where Orienta Ave and Old White Plains Road meet today.
location: Woman's Club of Mamaroneck, 504 Cortlandt Avenue. Mamaroneck, NY 10543

description: Get outside with other families and a naturalist at Sheldrake, as you discover nature with your little one. This class is designed to expose children to the joys of nature at a young age, towards the goal of cultivating a life-long love of the natural world. Adventures for wee ones might include looking for frogs, listening to birdsong, studying animal tracks, storytime, games, or crafts. There’s no shortage of educational fun on Sheldrake’s 60 acres!
when: Thursdays, September 25 - November 20, 2025, 10:00-11:00 am (8 weeks; class doesn't meet on 10/2)
location: Sheldrake, 685 Weaver St, Larchmont, NY 10538

description: Fall fun awaits at Sheldrake’s popular program for preschool-aged children. Get the kids outside for STEM fun and adventures on our 60 acres of protected land. Through a combination of trail exploration, games, stories, and other activities, we’ll enjoy loads of nature fun while observing the impact of the changing season on wildlife and habitats. Our naturalist-led program provides the opportunity for enrichment, connection with nature, and the company of other young enthusiasts.Our Forest Friends: get hands-on experience with science and nature on a 60-acre nature conservancy, learn about the animals and plant life that call Sheldrake home, savor the splendor of fall while observing how the natural world transitions to winter, foster appreciation for the natural world and establish the foundation for a life-long love of nature.
when: Wednesdays, October 8 - December 17, 2025 (10 weeks, class does not meet on 11/26), 3:45-4:45 pm
location: Sheldrake Environmental Center, 685 Weaver St, Larchmont, NY 10538

Part of the Sheldrake Second Saturday Series of free family programs, made possible by a generous grant from Con Edison. This program is not a drop-off; children must be accompanied by an adult. The event will be conducted entirely outdoors. Please leave pets at home.

location: Larchmont

description: Be part of our largest community event of the year! Join fellow members in sponsoring the Larchmont Chamber's largest community event of the year! Don't miss this opportunity to promote your business, engage your customers and create goodwill with the community. This event is reliant on the support of sponsorships and we know when we all show up together, great things happen! Explore the new and returning options and register now! Holiday Shopper's Passport:Kicking off on Small Business Saturday and lasting one week, participating businesses can list a promotion or offer on the printed passport. Participating locations can also be a distribution center for shoppers to get the passport and earn a sticker every time they make a purchase. When a shopper gets two stickers during the designated week, they turn in the card to the event sponsor and get rewarded with a prize. The kick-off on Nov. 29 will be supported by free trolley rides from noon - 4 pm thanks to the sponsorship of Anna & Jack's Treehouse. This event is open to ALL types of businesses and promotes shopping locally for great holiday gifts. Sign up online. If you don't have a brick-and-mortar location and want to discuss options, contact ginaproia@outlook.com. Holiday Dream Home Gingerbread Contest:Our nonprofit members will compete in a gingerbread house contest in hopes of winning one of three cash prizes. The nonprofit teams will be guided by a professional coach. Great opportunity for our service-based businesses to be part of the holiday events! Designers, architects, engineers, painters, contractors, etc... this one's for YOU! This new event is sponsored by Julie B. Fee Sotheby's and Chase! Sign up online. Holiday Stroll:Be part of this series of festive fun all through town where the community is invited to stroll, shop, sample treats and engage in holiday activities in business locations and outdoors in the business districts. Sponsors can choose to support the event overall and benefit from branding and promotion, without having to activate a Stroll activity, or you can sponsor a specific activity on the Stroll and have more direct connection with the community. This daytime event will be anchored by our returning horse-drawn carriages offering rides through town thanks to sponsorship by Houlihan Lawrence. This is a NEW activity and we are open to discussing ideas that suit your business if the below options don't fit. But, act fast. New ideas will only be considered in October. Contact Gina Proia, ginaproia@outlook.com to register for a Holiday Stroll activity.
location: Larchmont

description: Greetings Mamaroneck Avenue Businesses, We are looking forward to supporting the Village of Mamaroneck’s Annual Spooktacular Parade Sunday October 19, 2025 11am-2pm. There is no rain date. In partnership with the Village of Mamaroneck, we want to inform you of the following: Authorities will close Mamaroneck Avenue and prohibit vehicle traffic from 10am-1pm on 10/19 A large volume of toddler to school-aged children and their parents will gather at 448 Mamaroneck Avenue (Smashburger) by 11am and parade to Harbor Island Participants will then have a “Spooky” good time with candy distribution, haunted house, chamber sponsored games, and music hosted by volunteers and Chamber members starting around 12:15pm until 2pm at Harbor Island. We encourage and invite you to get involved and here are some options: 1. Donate candy in any amount - feel free to label with your business and include coupons or promotional material to be distributed at Harbor Island. All donations can be dropped off to Pam at the Village of Mamaroneck Recreation Office or email us at info@mamaroneckchamberofcommerce.org to arrange for pick-up. 2. Sponsor a game/activity and have a representative host a table at Harbor Island. Please email us to confirm and we will share available games/activities and assign table placement. First come, first served! 3. Offer volunteers! We need all the help we can get for all activities at any time between 10am-3pm (set-up, parade/activities, breakdown/cleanup). Thank you for your support! Please also post the included flier in your store window. The Mamaroneck Chamber of Commerce Board
location: Mamaroneck Ave to Harbor Island Park

event: In Our Backyard: The Local Impact of Immigration Crackdowns
description: In recent months the federal government has ramped up efforts to arrest and deport immigrants around the country. Dozens of families from our own community have been directly impacted, and countless others–many of whom have spent years pursuing legal residency–fear being apprehended themselves. Jirandy Martinez, Executive Director and Bertha Rodriguez, Managing Attorney of Mamaroneck’s Community Resource Center will join us to share their stories, as well as Sabina Calle, Marriage and Family Therapist, Community Counseling Center.
location: Nautilus Diner1240 W Boston Post Rd, Mamaroneck, NY

description: Explore our sensory stations while practicing early literacy and fine motor skills. Ages 2-4 with a caregiver. No registration is required for this program. Just drop-in!
location: The Michael P. Coords Activity Room at Larchmont Public Library, 121 Larchmont Ave, Larchmont, NY 10538

description: This imaginative workshop blends art, science, games, and storytelling into an adventure through time! Our second stop in time is the Apollo 11 mission. Build and test a lunar lander, create beautiful spacescape artwork, simulate a rocket launch, & more
location: The Michael P. Coords Activity Room at Larchmont Public Library, 121 Larchmont Ave, Larchmont, NY 10538

description: For Children in Grades 2-4 Does your child love telling stories and creating art? This program pairs children with Mamaroneck High School students to help them write & illustrate their own storybooks! Each book will take 3 sessions to create. Child must attend all sessions. Caregivers must stay in the library building for the duration of the program.
location: The Michael P. Coords Activity Room at Larchmont Public Library, 121 Larchmont Ave, Larchmont, NY 10538

description: Scott Ahrens, from the NYS Department of Financial Services, will cover topics including filling out the FAFSA, grants, scholarships, types of loans, determining the amount of aid you qualify for, and provide an overview of available New York State programs. Q & A will follow.
location: The Michael P. Coords Activity Room at Larchmont Public Library, 121 Larchmont Ave, Larchmont, NY 10538

event: Exploring Our Colorful World with Chris McCormack on Zoom or Simulcast In Person
description: Join us on a captivating journey through the vivid tapestry of our planet in "Exploring Our Colorful World", an immersive program that celebrates the diversity, flavor, and wonder of global cultures. Professional traveler Chris McCormack will transport audiences across continents, weaving together the threads of food, geography, people, and urban vibrance to paint a panoramic portrait of our shared human experience. Chris McCormack will NOT be at the library in person.
location: The Village Center (entrance at rear of Library) at Larchmont Public Library, 121 Larchmont Avenue, Larchmont, NY 10538

description: Meet and make toddler friends during this unstructured playtime full of blocks, balls, and stacking toys! Even a play kitchen. *This is a drop-in, self-guided program, please clean up when you are finished playing*. Caregiver must attend and be engaged with their child. Drop offs will not be permitted.
location: The Michael P. Coords Activity Room at Larchmont Public Library, 121 Larchmont Ave, Larchmont, NY 10538

description: Join Certified Yoga Instructor Vincenza Madonia, for these six sessions of Chair Yoga. Chair Yoga consists of arm, leg and head movements, as well as twisting your torso, that are done while seated in a chair. There are also standing movements that use a chair for support. Please sign up if you want reminders or want to be on an email list for this program.
location: The Village Center (entrance at rear of Library) at Larchmont Public Library, 121 Larchmont Avenue, Larchmont, NY 10538

description: All levels welcome. Bring your own mat. Franklin Shire is a certified Kripalu Yoga Instructor, teaching in Westchester since 2007. His classes are gentle to moderate, a breath based meditative practice of patient self-awareness, leaving one feeling renewed, with a sense of stillness and focus. Donations are not required but are welcome. Registration is required for this event. Registration will close on December 26, 2025 @ 11:00am.
location: The Village Center (entrance at rear of Library) at Larchmont Public Library, 121 Larchmont Avenue, Larchmont, NY 10538

description: Dive into the world of adorable art! Create very own cute food using air-dry clay! This workshop combines creativity and fun as you mold delightful miniature treats. Kids attend the program on their own. Caregivers must stay in the library building for the duration of the program. Kids 10 and older can be dropped off for this program.
location: The Michael P. Coords Activity Room at Larchmont Public Library, 121 Larchmont Ave, Larchmont, NY 10538

description: Join certified QiGong teacher Steve Goldstein and learn about the ancient Chinese form of gentle exercise composed of movements that are repeated a number of times and can be performed by just about anyone. Participants are encouraged to wear comfortable clothing. Steve has trained with some of the leading experts in the fields of Energy Medicine, Reiki, Shamanism, Qigong, and Acupressure. Most recently he was an Earth Science teacher at Hommocks Middle School. Please sign up if you want reminders or want to be on an email list for this program.
location: The Village Center (entrance at rear of Library), Larchmont Public Library, 121 Larchmont Avenue, Larchmont, NY 10538

description: Join the Library for a Puzzle Swap!Do you have a closet full of puzzles you’ve already completed? Would you like to pass those puzzles to someone who also enjoys doing puzzles and get new ones for yourself in return? The Swap is a great way for you to pick up some puzzles to work on during the holidays with friends and family! It’s simple! Bring any puzzles in good condition which you’d like to swap and leave them on the tables set up in the Village Center. When you drop off your puzzles, take a few puzzles home with you! Remember, this is a swap, not a donation drive. Stick around for a while to enjoy refreshments and work on a community puzzle. The remaining puzzles left at the end of the day will be donated to the Library’s circulating puzzle collection, New Jewish Home, Sarah Neuman in Mamaroneck and Puzzles-to-Remember, a non-profit organization that distributes puzzles to facilities that care for people with Alzheimer’s disease.
location: The Village Center (entrance at rear of Library) at Larchmont Public Library, 121 Larchmont Avenue, Larchmont, NY 10538

description: Join us for a Saturday afternoon game of chess. Chess pieces are provided.
location: Main Floor Conference Room at Larchmont Public Library, 121 Larchmont Ave, Larchmont, NY 10538

event: "Intro to Percussion" with Larchmont Music Academy
description: Get ready to drum, shake, and tap along! Join the Larchmont Music Academy! faculty and students for an exciting introduction to percussion instruments from around the world. Children ages 4–8 will explore rhythm using drums like the djembe, conga, and more. Enjoy live demonstrations and a chance to make some music of your own in this fun, interactive class for Children Ages 4-8 & their caregivers
location: The Michael P. Coords Activity Room at Larchmont Public Library, 121 Larchmont Ave, Larchmont, NY 10538
target_age: 4-8, preschool, younger school age, older school age

description: The Battle of Monmouth was fought in NJ on June 28, 1778. Pitting the Continental Army, led by General George Washington, against the British Army commanded by General Sir Henry Clinton, it was the last battle of the Philadelphia campaign, during which the British inflicted two major defeats on Washington and occupied Philadelphia. But Washington had spent the winter at Valley Forge, training and rebuilding his army. Will all the hardship and training pay off?
location: The Michael P. Coords Activity Room at Larchmont Public Library, 121 Larchmont Ave, Larchmont, NY 10538

description: Come and experience the musical talent of Robert the Guitar Guy while you clap and dance along to the beat! AGES 0-3 with a caregiver. Caregiver Must Attend: This program is designed for children and their caregiver. Please plan to attend and be engaged with your child for this program. Drop offs will not be permitted. Drop-in Program: No registration is required for this program. Just drop-in!
location: The Village Center (entrance at rear of Library) at Larchmont Public Library, 121 Larchmont Ave, Larchmont, NY 10538

description: Come to the library to play Mahjong and/or Canasta! This is open game-play for players of all levels as long as you understand the basics of game play. The library has Mah Jongg sets and playing cards, but players are encouraged to bring their own. This is a drop in program. No registration required.
location: The Michael P. Coords Activity Room at Larchmont Public Library, 121 Larchmont Ave, Larchmont, NY 10538

description: Join Linnea or Kristi for some fun stories and an accompanying craft. This program is designed for children and their caregiver. Please plan to attend and be engaged with your child for this program. Drop offs will not be permitted. Registration is required.

event: Project Linus: Knitting and Crochet Group
description: Come join our weekly knitting and crocheting group and help make security blankets for children who need a little comfort. We donate to Hospitals, Day Care Centers, Food Banks (such as L/M Food Pantry), and other places where there are children who need a little support. No registration required. Bring your own materials! If you have questions or wish to make a donation please contact Doris-Patt Smith at momdsmith1@yahoo.com
location: The Village Center (entrance at rear of Library) at Larchmont Public Library, 121 Larchmont Avenue, Larchmont, NY 10538

Be prepared to have your baby in your lap!* For Infants 0-12 Months. This program is designed for children and their caregiver. Please plan to attend and be engaged with your child for this program. Drop offs will not be permitted.

description: Get ready to shake it off at our Butter Making Dance Extravaganza! You can take your butter home and use it on your Thanksgiving table. Registration is required for this event. event: Spanish Conversations with María-Cristina Sánchez on Zoom
description: Join María-Cristina Sánchez and hone your Spanish skills. Ms Sánchez will propose discussion topics in Spanish for each session, providing participants with the opportunity to clarify pronunciation and meaning of words and expressions in an informal and relaxed environment. Participants should speak Spanish at an intermediate to advanced level and not be native speakers of Spanish. Ms. Sánchez is a native Spanish-speaker originally from Ecuador and has studied languages in Quito, Boston, Paris and Vienna. Registration is required once and then you will receive the Zoom link immediately and the day before each session.
location: Online at Larchmont Public Library
